column2:
name
  1. Autonomous region of Italy situated in the Alps. See Valle d'Aosta (it)

noun
  1. bagna cauda (dip made from anchovies, olive oil and garlic)

noun
  1. A small glass.
  2. A Turinese beverage made of espresso, hot chocolate, and milk.

noun
  1. A bonnet or cap.
  2. (by extension) A sort of rounded cake mold.
  3. A traditional Piedmontese pudding prepared with cocoa and amaretti.

column1: esse|a son|a fussa|a sio|i sio|i soma|a l'era|i fusse|i sia|it sarìe|i fusso|a sia|i sarìe|i sarìa|i j'ere|it ses|i sareve|it sie|a sarìo|i son|essend|it saras|i j'era|it fusse|a sarìa|i fussa|i sie|i j'ero|i sarìo|a j'ero|i seve|it j'ere|i saran|a fusso|i sarai|a sarà|a l'é|i saroma|stàit

column2:
verb
  1. to flower, to bloom
  2. to flourish, to prosper

noun
  1. A terracotta pot, with a space underneath for a heater, used to make bagna cauda or fonduta.

noun
  1. mister, sir (a title or form of address for a man)

adj
  1. tired (physically, mentally, or emotionally fatigued)
  2. (figuratively) drained, worn out
  3. fed up

noun
  1. (chiefly in the plural) taglierini, tagliolini (pasta thinner than tagliatelle)
  2. (particularly) A type of it that is thicker than capellini, traditionally served with meat sauces; a dish of Langhe and Montferrat.
